title: Augusta County: John Scott to E. P. Smith, December 12, 1868
summary: Concerned about the future success of the AMA schools in Staunton, Scott argues that he was forced to insist upon employing white teachers over black teachers against the wishes of many "influential colored people in the community." He comments on the arrival of "Miss Daveson" and expresses his apprehension about her teaching abilities.
keywords: African Americans, Education, Race Relations, Women, American Civil War
